intro: Anthemiopsis elongata, commonly known as the elongated anthemiopsis, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
